entry.title: Cleaning Movies Data for Tableau Visualization
entry.summary:
Project Details
You are a business analyst consultant and your client is a new movie production company looking to make a new movie. The client wants to make sure it’s successful to help make a name for the new company. They are relying on you to help understand movie trends to help inform their decision making. They’ve given you guidance to look into three specific areas:
entry.content:

  margin: 0px;

}

}
div.cell.selected {

}

}

}

.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;

}

}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;

}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {

}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there

div.prompt:empty {

 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See

 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  padding: 0.4em;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. We need the 0 value because of how we size */
  /* .CodeMirror-lines */
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;

  display: -webkit-box;

  -moz-box-orient: vertical;

  display: flex;

  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);

}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {

}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}

.output {

div.output_area pre {

  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;

}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {

}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different

/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {

  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {

}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {

}

div.raw_input_container {

}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {

}
p.p-space {

<style type="text/css">.highlight .hll { background-color: #ffffcc }
.highlight  { background: #f8f8f8; }
.highlight .c { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment */
.highlight .err { border: 1px solid #FF0000 } /* Error */
.highlight .k { color: #008000; font-weight: bold } /* Keyword */
.highlight .o { color: #666666 } /* Operator */
.highlight .ch { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Hashbang */
.highlight .cm { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Multiline */
.highlight .cp { color: #BC7A00 } /* Comment.Preproc */
.highlight .cpf { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.PreprocFile */
.highlight .c1 { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Single */
.highlight .cs { color: #408080; font-style: italic } /* Comment.Special */

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Project Details</strong>
<br />
You are a business analyst consultant and your client is a new movie production company looking to make a new movie. The client wants to make sure it’s successful to help make a name for the new company. They are relying on you to help understand movie trends to help inform their decision making. They’ve given you guidance to look into three specific areas:</p>
<p>Question 1: How have movies based on novels performed relative to movies not based on novels?
<br />
Question 2: How do the attributes differ between Universal Pictures and Paramount Pictures?
<br />
Question 3: How have movie genres changed over time?</p>
<p>In this blog post, I will clean the data and get the dataset ready for Tableau visualization. In the second part of the post, I will attempt to answer these questions using Tableau Dashboard and Stories.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><img alt="poster_tmdb" src="images/poster_tmdb.png" />
<br />
Source:- <a href="https://www.themoviedb.org/movie/now-playing?language=en">TheMovieDB</a></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Getting-Started">Getting Started<a class="anchor-link" href="#Getting-Started">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Import the libraries needed</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="kn">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="kn">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">re</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">calendar</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The original data used for the analysis can be downloaded from the following <a href="https://d17h27t6h515a5.cloudfront.net/topher/2017/January/587e7057_movies/movies.csv">link</a>. When I tried to open the file directly using pandas read_csv module, I ran into following error- "UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xcc in position 12: invalid continuation byte". So I had to open the file in Sublime Text and save it with utf-8 encoding. This allowed me to open the file using pandas read_csv module.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Load the data into a pandas dataframe</span>
<span class="n">movies</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"data/movies.csv"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Data-clean-up">Data clean up<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data-clean-up">¶</a></h2><p>If we look at the dataset the information needed to answer the questions isn't readily available. We need to do some preprocessing on relevant columns to dig out the information needed to answer the questions. 
<br />We will start by fixing the columns that pertain to the question we are trying to address.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Question 1: How have movies based on novels performed relative to movies not based on novels?</strong>
<br />
To address this question we need to find movies that are based on novels. This information is primarily available in <code>keywords</code> column and in <code>tagline</code> column. Instead of fixing the genres column for the entire dataset, I select few columns and make a subset of data to work with it.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [389]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies_novels</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"keywords"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"tagline"</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">drop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[389]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As I went through the <code>keywords</code> column, I noticed that there are multiple phrases that could tell whether a movie is based on novel - <code>'based on novel'</code>, <code>'based on graphic novel'</code>, <code>'inspired by novel'</code> etc. In order to list all of the possible phrases we could be dealing with, I write a regular expression script to search for the first occurrence of phrase with <code>'novel'</code> in each row. The function returns either the phrase with <code>'novel'</code> in it or None.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [390]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_novel_from_keywords</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">keywords</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">match</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(\|{0,1}[\w\s]*novel[\w\s]*\|{0,1})"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">keywords</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">group</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">TypeError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    
<span class="n">phrases_with_novel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">text</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"keywords"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()):</span>
    <span class="n">pattern</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_novel_from_keywords</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">phrases_with_novel</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pattern</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">phrases_with_novel</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>{'|inspired by novel', '|novelist', '|stolen novel|', '|based on graphic novel', '|based on novel', '|based on novel|', '|based on graphic novel|', '|novelist|', 'based on novel', '|tell all novel|', None, 'based on graphic novel|', 'based on novel|'}
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Hmm! there are several phrases with <code>'novel'</code> in it, but only three phrases tell us if a movie is based on a novel. The three phrases are - <code>'based on novel'</code>, <code>'based on graphic novel'</code>, and <code>'inspired by novel'</code>. Next, we will create a column <code>based_on_novel_0</code> that looks for those three phrases from <code>keywords</code> column and returns True if the movie is novel based.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [391]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_novel_based_movie</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">keywords</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">match1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(\|{0,1}based[\w\s]*novel\|{0,1})"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">keywords</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">match2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(\|{0,1}inspired[\w\s]*novel\|{0,1})"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">keywords</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">match1</span> <span class="ow">or</span> <span class="n">match2</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">True</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">False</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">TypeError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    
<span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"based_on_novel_0"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"keywords"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">find_novel_based_movie</span><span class="p">)</span>  
<span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It is also quite likely that information for whether a movie is based on novel is in <code>tagline</code> column. Let us search <code>tagline</code> column for any phrase with novel in it.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [392]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_novel_from_tagline</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tagline</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">match</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(.*novel.*)"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tagline</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">group</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">TypeError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    
<span class="n">phrases_with_novel_1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">text</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"tagline"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()):</span>
    <span class="n">pattern</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_novel_from_tagline</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">phrases_with_novel_1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pattern</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">phrases_with_novel_1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>{'Based on the best-selling novel', 'Based on the novel of Chico Xavier', 'Based on the novel by Henry James', 'The #1 novel of the year - now a motion picture!', None}
</pre>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>There were four movies based on novel for which the information was present in <code>tagline</code> column. Next, we will create a column <code>based_on_novel_1</code> that looks for those phrases from <code>tagline</code> column and returns True if the movie is novel based.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [393]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_novel_based_movie_1</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tagline</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">match</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(.*novel.*)"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tagline</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">True</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">False</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">TypeError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    
<span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"based_on_novel_1"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"tagline"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">find_novel_based_movie_1</span><span class="p">)</span>  
<span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We are only interested in finding whether a movie is based on novel. We are not concerned whether that information comes from <code>keywords</code> column or <code>tagline</code> column. We will create a single column <code>based_on_novel</code> from <code>based_on_novel_0</code> and <code>based_on_novel_1</code>. At the same time, we will now drop columns we don't need anymore.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [394]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"based_on_novel"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"based_on_novel_0"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"based_on_novel_1"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"keywords"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"tagline"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"based_on_novel_0"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"based_on_novel_1"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<p>We will now convert the <code>based_on_novel</code> column from integers to boolean. Before that, we need to check the different integer values that are there in the column beside 0 and 1. It is quite likely that information for movie based on a novel is present on both the columns- <code>keywords</code> and <code>tagline</code>. As a result, some of the values for <code>based_on_novel</code> might be two. Let's check that out.</p>

        vertical-align: top;

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now we have our new column <code>based_on_novel</code> in a format that can be used for Tableau visualization. Let's drop the <code>keywords</code> and <code>tagline</code> columns in the original dataset and merge the movies_novels data subsets with the original movie dataset using <code>id</code> and <code>original_title</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [399]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">"keywords"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"tagline"</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># We will use the merge function in pandas to merge the scraped data subsets and original movies dataset. </span>
<span class="c1"># The merge function in pandas is similar to join in SQL.</span>
<span class="n">movies</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">,</span>
                  <span class="n">movies_novels</span><span class="p">,</span>
                  <span class="n">how</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"left"</span><span class="p">,</span>
                  <span class="n">left_on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">],</span>
                  <span class="n">right_on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">movies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Question 2: How do the attributes differ between Universal Pictures and Paramount Pictures?</strong>
<br />
To answer this question we need to tidy up the <code>production_companies</code> column. Each row of <code>production_companies</code> column contains several production companies separated by | and there can be a maximum of five companies. We are interested in finding out whether a movie was produced by Universal Pictures, or Paramount Pictures, or None.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [400]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies_production_companies</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"production_companies"</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">drop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">movies_production_companies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[400]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style>
    .dataframe thead tr:only-child th {
        text-align: right;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: left;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }
</style>

<th>production_companies</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>0</th>
<td>135397</td>
<td>Jurassic World</td>
<td>Universal Studios|Amblin Entertainment|Legenda...</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>1</th>
<td>76341</td>
<td>Mad Max: Fury Road</td>
<td>Village Roadshow Pictures|Kennedy Miller Produ...</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>2</th>
<td>262500</td>
<td>Insurgent</td>
<td>Summit Entertainment|Mandeville Films|Red Wago...</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>3</th>
<td>140607</td>
<td>Star Wars: The Force Awakens</td>
<td>Lucasfilm|Truenorth Productions|Bad Robot</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th>4</th>
<td>168259</td>
<td>Furious 7</td>
<td>Universal Pictures|Original Film|Media Rights ...</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As I skimmed through the <code>production_companies</code> column, I noticed that Universal Studios was not named consistently - Universal Studios, Universal Pictures, Universal etc. In order to find out all the possible names of Universal Studios we could be dealing with, I wrote a script to search for the first occurrence of phrase with 'Universal' in each row. The function returns either the phrase with word Universal in it or None.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [401]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_Universal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">production_company</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">match</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(\|{0,1}[\w\s]*Universal[\w\s]*\|{0,1})"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">production_company</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">group</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">TypeError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    
<span class="n">words_with_Universal</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">text</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies_production_companies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"production_companies"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()):</span>
    <span class="n">pattern</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_Universal</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">words_with_Universal</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pattern</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words_with_Universal</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>{'Universal Pictures', 'Universal Cable Productions|', 'Universal Cartoon Studios|', 'Universal 1440 Entertainment', '|Universal Home Entertainment', '|Universal Studios Home Entertainment|', '|Universal International Pictures ', '|Universal Cartoon Studios|', '|Universal 1440 Entertainment', 'Universal', '|Universal City Studios|', '|Universal CGI|', 'Universal TV', '|Universal Pictures International ', 'Universal Pictures Germany GmbH', 'Universal TV|', '|Universal Pictures', 'Universal Pictures International ', '|Universal Studios Home Entertainment', '|Universal Television', 'Universal Pictures Corporation', '|Universal City Studios', '|Universal Music', 'NBC Universal Television|', '|NBC Universal Global Networks|', 'Universal Home Entertainment', 'Universal Pictures|', '|Universal Family and Home Entertainment', '|Universal Studios Sound Facilities', 'Universal Studios|', '|Universal|', '|Universal Pictures|', 'Universal Studios Home Entertainment Family Productions|', '|Universal Network Television|', 'Universal Studios', 'NBC Universal Television', 'Universal Productions France S', 'Universal Cartoon Studios', 'Universal Studios Home Entertainment', None, '|Universal 1440 Entertainment|', '|Universal Home Video'}
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Huh! there are several phrases with Universal in it. I googled to figure out if these were all divisions of the same company. The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Pictures">wikipedia</a> page states - "Universal Pictures (also referred to as Universal Studios or simply Universal) is an American film studio owned by Comcast through the Universal Filmed Entertainment Group division of its wholly owned subsidiary NBCUniversal." An extensive search revealed that these are all part of American multinational media conglomerate NBCUniversal.
<br />
I also wanted to go ahead and check if it was similar case for Paramount Pictures. I wrote a similar script to search for the first occurrence of phrase with 'Paramount' in each row.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [402]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_Paramount</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">production_company</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">match</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(\|{0,1}[\w\s]*Paramount[\w\s]*\|{0,1})"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">production_company</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">match</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">group</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">TypeError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    
<span class="n">words_with_Paramount</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">text</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies_production_companies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"production_companies"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()):</span>
    <span class="n">pattern</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_Paramount</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">words_with_Paramount</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pattern</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words_with_Paramount</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>{'|Paramount Television|', '|Paramount Pictures', 'Paramount Famous Productions', '|Paramount Classics', '|Paramount Home Entertainment', 'Paramount Vantage', 'Paramount Classics', 'Paramount Vantage|', '|Paramount Vantage|', 'Paramount Pictures|', 'Paramount Pictures', '|Paramount Classics|', 'Paramount|', '|Paramount Vantage', '|Paramount Pictures Digital Entertainment|', None, '|Paramount Animation', 'Paramount Home Entertainment', 'Paramount Pictures Digital Entertainment'}
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As stated in <a href="">Wikipedia</a> - "Paramount Pictures Corporation (also known as Paramount Pictures and simply Paramount) is an American film studio based in Hollywood, California, that has been a subsidiary of the American media conglomerate Viacom since 1994." These above-listed names are all subsidiaries of the same company. 
<br />
Now we can write some code to tag all the companies with Universal in their names as Universal and all the companies with Paramount in their names as Paramount, and neither as None for our purpose. To do this, I used a regular expression that searches for the first occurrence of Universal or Paramount in each row of <code>production_companies</code> column.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [403]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_Universal_or_Paramount</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">production_company</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">universal</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(\|{0,1}[\w\s]*Universal[\w\s]*\|{0,1})"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">production_company</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">paramount</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"(\|{0,1}[\w\s]*Paramount[\w\s]*\|{0,1})"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">production_company</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">universal</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="s2">"Universal"</span>
        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">paramount</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="s2">"Paramount"</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">TypeError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">None</span>

<span class="c1"># Transform the original 'production_companies' to only keep relevant information</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"production_companies"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"production_companies"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">find_Universal_or_Paramount</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># We can see that the production_companies column has been transformed in the original dataset</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[403]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style>
    .dataframe thead tr:only-child th {
        text-align: right;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>While we are here, let us also extract day, month, and day of the week information from the date column. We will create these three new columns in the original movies dataset itself. These attributes can be used for exploring the seasonal effect on movie's performance.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [404]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_month"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DatetimeIndex</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_date"</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">month</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_month"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_month"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">calendar</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">month_abbr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_day"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DatetimeIndex</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_date"</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">day</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_dayofweek"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DatetimeIndex</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"release_date"</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">weekday_name</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We will also calculate two important metrics that we will use later for Tableau visualization.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [405]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"profit"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"revenue"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"budget"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"profit (%)"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"revenue"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"budget"</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"budget"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"profit_adj"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"revenue_adj"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"budget_adj"</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [406]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Write the dataframe to csv file for Tableau visualization.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [407]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'data/movies_cleaned.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span>
             <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Question 3: How have movie genres changed over time?</strong>
<br />
Problem: The <code>genres</code> column consists of multiple genres in the same cell separated by "|". To tidy this data up, we need to have one genre per row associated with their respective id. Instead of fixing the <code>genres</code> column for the entire dataset, I select few columns and make a subset of data to work with it.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [408]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies_genres</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"genres"</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">drop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[408]:</div>

<td>Action|Adventure|Science Fiction|Thriller</td>
</tr>

</tr>

<td>Action|Crime|Thriller</td>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>First, we separate multiple genres associated with each movie into multiple columns. We know from the data specifications that there can be a maximum of five genres for each movie, so we will separate the <code>genres</code> column into five columns.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [409]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'genre1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'genre2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'genre3'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'genre4'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'genre5'</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'genres'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="s2">"|"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">expand</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="k">del</span> <span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'genres'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>genres</code> variable is now spread out across multiple columns and the data is in wide format. As a final tidying step, we will use pandas melt function to convert the dataset from wide to tall format.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [410]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">movies_genres</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">melt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">id_vars</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">],</span>
                       <span class="n">value_name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"genres"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">var_name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"genre_n"</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Drop rows with no values in genres column</span>
<span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dropna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">subset</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'genres'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

</pre></div>

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Delete the original genres column in the movies dataset</span>
<span class="k">del</span> <span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"genres"</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># Merge the dataframes</span>
<span class="n">movies_cleaned_genres</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">movies</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                 <span class="n">movies_genres</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                 <span class="n">how</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"right"</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                 <span class="n">left_on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">],</span>
                                 <span class="n">right_on</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"id"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"original_title"</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="c1"># Write the dataframe to csv file for Tableau visualization.</span>
<span class="n">movies_cleaned_genres</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'data/movies_cleaned_genres.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                             <span class="n">index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

entry.title: Shiny Greenhouse App
entry.summary:
"During 2016, Earth's globally averaged surface temperature was 0.94$^{\circ}$C higher than the twentieth-century century average. All 16 years of the twenty-first century rank among the 17 warmest years on record." - National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)

If you know me I deeply care about the health of our planet. The biggest threat our civilization and the life of planet right now is global warming. According to Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change - "Scientific evidence for warming of the climate system is unequivocal". "Majority of Scientists

}

div.input_area {

/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is

div.input_prompt {

 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See

}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  padding: 0.4em;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. We need the 0 value because of how we size */
  /* .CodeMirror-lines */
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h5:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h6:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}








.rendered_html * + ul {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html * + ol {
  margin-top: 1em;
}


.rendered_html pre,



.rendered_html tr,
.rendered_html th,

.rendered_html td,


.rendered_html * + table {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + p {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + img {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html img,

.rendered_html img.unconfined,

div.text_cell {

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>"During 2016, Earth's globally averaged surface temperature was 0.94$^{\circ}$C higher than the twentieth-century century average. All 16 years of the twenty-first century rank among the 17 warmest years on record." - <a href="https://www.climate.gov/news-features/understanding-climate/climate-change-global-temperature">National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)</a></p>
<p>If you know me I deeply care about the health of our planet. The biggest threat our civilization and the life of planet right now is global warming. According to Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change - "Scientific evidence for warming of the climate system is unequivocal". "<a href="http://www.ipcc.ch/report/ar5/wg2/">Majority of Scientists</a> agree that rising temperatures will fuel longer and hotter heat waves, drought, crop failures, powerful hurricanes, rising sea levels, flooding of coastal cities, mass migration crisis and mass extinction." - <a href="http://www.cnn.com/2017/06/01/politics/us-paris-agreement-trump/index.html">CNN</a>.</p>
<p><img alt="greenhouse_effect" src="images/greenhouse_effect.jpg" />
Source: <a href="https://climate.nasa.gov/causes/">NASA</a></p>
<p>The invisible culprit - anthropogenic greenhouse gases (GHG) emissions. These gases collect in the atmosphere and absorb sunlight and solar radiation that increases the earth's temperature. The increase in greenhouse gas emissions is the major driver of climate change.</p>
<p>In this project, I explore greenhouse gas emissions data for all the countries from  <a href="http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/EN.ATM.GHGT.KT.CE">worldbank</a>. We asked - which countries share a bigger share of responsibility to curb the emissions? In the process, I build a <a href="https://arjan-hada.shinyapps.io/greenhouse-gas/"><strong>Shiny app</strong></a> to interactively explore 42 years of greenhouse gas emissions data through different visualizations.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>My app can be accessed at <a href="https://arjan-hada.shinyapps.io/greenhouse-gas/"><strong>https://arjan-hada.shinyapps.io/greenhouse-gas/</strong></a>. Let me know what you think of the app.</p>
<p><img alt="app_preview" src="images/app_preview.png" /></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Reference">Reference<a class="anchor-link" href="#Reference">¶</a></h2><p>1) <a href="http://r4ds.had.co.nz/">R for Data Science</a>
<br />
2) <a href="https://www.udacity.com/course/data-analysis-with-r--ud651">Data Analysis with R</a>
<br />
3) <a href="http://www.harcourtbrown.com/a-unique-visualization-of-global-greenhouse-gas-emissions">A Unique Visualization of Greenhouse Gas Emissions</a>
<br />
4) <a href="https://www.climate.gov/news-features/understanding-climate/climate-change-global-temperature">Climate Change: Global Temperature</a>
<br />
3) <a href="http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/EN.ATM.GHGT.KT.CE">Worldbank Greenhouse gas emissions</a>
<br />
4) <a href="https://rstudio.github.io/leaflet/">Leaflet for R</a>
<br />
5) <a href="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/WDI/README.html">World Development Indicator</a>
<br />
6) <a href="http://data.okfn.org/data/core/geo-countries#data">Country Polygons as GeoJSON</a>
<br />
7) <a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/walkerke/teaching-with-datavis/master/wdi-leaflet/wdi_leaflet.R">WDI leaflet tutorial</a>
<br />
8) <a href="http://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/movie-explorer.html">Shiny app - movie-explorer</a>
<br />
9) <a href="https://rstudio.github.io/shinydashboard/examples.html">Shinydashboard examples</a>
<br />
10) <a href="https://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/superzip-example.html">Shiny app - superzip-example</a>
<br /></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">if (!document.getElementById('mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#')) {
    var mathjaxscript = document.createElement('script');
    mathjaxscript.id = 'mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#';
    mathjaxscript.type = 'text/javascript';
    mathjaxscript.src = '//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.1/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML';
    mathjaxscript[(window.opera ? "innerHTML" : "text")] =
        "MathJax.Hub.Config({" +
        "    config: ['MMLorHTML.js']," +
        "    TeX: { extensions: ['AMSmath.js','AMSsymbols.js','noErrors.js','noUndefined.js'], equationNumbers: { autoNumber: 'AMS' } }," +
        "    jax: ['input/TeX','input/MathML','output/HTML-CSS']," +
        "    extensions: ['tex2jax.js','mml2jax.js','MathMenu.js','MathZoom.js']," +
        "    displayAlign: 'center'," +
        "    displayIndent: '0em'," +
        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +

        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
